result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald John Leicher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/07/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-23
*8/7/2015 Agent to notify the Court if a new date is needed.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA and DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharge due to inability to pay. Cash bail applied.

- No contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

- Batterers Intervention program.
- Parenting classes.
- Absolute sobriety, breath tests.
- AODA evaluation and comply with recommended treatment.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by the Agent.
- No VIOLENT Contact with S. R. or Sarah R.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- DNA sample NOT ordered.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED; pending a review

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald John Leicher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended to comply with the hearing held on 8/7/2015.

Defendant Ronald John Leicher in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Agent to notify the court if a new date is needed.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 80 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 DAY time served, with Huber privileges for work ONLY.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 40 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety, breath tests.
-AODA evaluation and comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with S.R. or Sarah R.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-DNA Sample NOT ordered.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Ronald John Leicher in court with attorney Christopher D. Donovan.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Request for Probationary Sentence of 8-12 Months.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact order. Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Ronald John Leicher in court with attorney Christopher D. Donovan.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald John Leicher in court with attorney Christopher D. Donovan.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests an adjourned Pretrial Conference. Case heard off the record. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for a Pretrial Conference to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Off the record.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Case transferred FORTHWITH to Br. 23 for Pretrial Conference.   mld

01-26-2015
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; and no possession of any firearms or weapons.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SR; and SR.

Defendant Ronald John Leicher in court.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. Defendant states he will retain counsel.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/27/15 @ 1:30pm
